title: How to Script Manifest: Easy Steps to Use the Law of Attraction

steps.title: Script manifesting is writing down what you want in life.
steps.content: Script manifesting is writing down what you want in life. This might be as simple as writing about something you want to buy or something you want to attract to you, like love. Additionally, you can also use script manifesting to accomplish a goal or to create your dream life. [2] X Expert Source Jennifer McVey, Cht Spiritual Director Expert Interview. 21 December 2021. Some people write out an entire story about what they want their life to be like in the future. Others like to write out affirmations. You could also write about something you want, like a new car or a partner.

steps.title: Writing a script is one way to use the Law of Attraction (LOA).
steps.content: Writing a script is one way to use the Law of Attraction (LOA). According to the LOA, you can create the life you want by thinking positively and visualizing what you want. [3] X Expert Source Jennifer McVey, Cht Spiritual Director Expert Interview. 21 December 2021. It’s kind of like speaking things into existence, and people who practice it often believe it works both ways. You can draw positive or negative experiences, depending on what you tell yourself. [4] X Research source As an example, you’ll accomplish a lot more at work or school if you tell yourself, “I am capable” than if you say, “This is too hard.” When practicing the LOA, it’s important to remember that you aren’t to blame for traumatic events, harm inflicted by others, or difficult circumstances. It’s absolutely not your fault if something bad happens to you. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Scripting is an alternative to traditional visualization.
steps.content: Scripting is an alternative to traditional visualization. With manifesting, you typically visualize yourself in the future, living your ideal life. You might be working at your dream job, enjoying a lovely home, or driving a new car. [6] X Research source For some people, visualization is really hard. Fortunately, script manifesting allows you to put your thoughts on paper instead.

steps.title: Start from a place of gratitude and positivity.
steps.content: Start from a place of gratitude and positivity. Manifesting only works if you approach it with a grateful heart. Focusing on how much you need something can accidentally send a message to the universe that you’re lacking. [7] X Research source It’s easy to practice gratitude . All you need to do is be thankful for what you have. [8] X Research source You might be grateful for beautiful weather, a comfortable home, and love from your pet. You you could keep a gratitude journal .

steps.title: Use present tense.
steps.content: Use present tense. The trickiest part of script manifesting is remembering that the future is now. When you script manifest, you act like you already have what you want. So, write like your dream is happening to you right now. [9] X Expert Source Jennifer McVey, Cht Spiritual Director Expert Interview. 21 December 2021. You’d write, “I’m on my vacation to Hawaii soaking up the sun on the beach,” not “I’m going to vacation in Hawaii this summer.”

steps.title: Write about what it’s like to have what you want.
steps.content: Write about what it’s like to have what you want. Picture yourself sometime in the future with the life you want. Maybe you’re head-over-heels in love, or perhaps you finally have your dream job. You could be holding the keys to your brand new car, or relaxing in your cozy new house. Jot down a a few sentences describing what your perfect future looks like. [10] X Research source It’s totally up to you how much you write. You might write a couple of sentences about a car you want, or you might write several pages about how you want to spend your ideal day. There are no wrong answers. You may prefer to just write an affirmation or one word that represents what you want. Do what works best for you. This is your manifestation practice.

steps.title: Include specific details using your 5 senses.
steps.content: Include specific details using your 5 senses. The more detailed your script, the more likely it will come true. [11] X Expert Source Jennifer McVey, Cht Spiritual Director Expert Interview. 21 December 2021. When you write about the specifics, it helps you really focus on what you want so you can go after it. In addition to a visual description, use your imagination to describe the textures, scents, sounds, and tastes you’ll experience when you achieve your goal. [12] X Research source You could write: “My car smells like new leather and has warming seats. I listen to the purr of the engine as I cruise around the city.” “Alex and I are on a date in my favorite Italian restaurant. The live band is playing a romantic song while Alex tells me about his day. We both ordered the spaghetti, and I can’t help but think of the date scene in Lady and the Tramp .”

steps.title: Focus only on what you want–not on what you want to avoid.
steps.content: Focus only on what you want–not on what you want to avoid. It’s really easy to slip into a list of what you don’t want. However, that comes from a place of negativity, so it can really mess up your manifestation efforts. Remember to stick to positive statements only. [13] X Research source Steer clear of things like, “I don’t want a used car,” “I only want to go to my top choices for school,” or “I don’t want a promotion if it doesn’t come with a raise.”

steps.title: Try the 3-6-9 method to attract a specific item or person.
steps.content: Try the 3-6-9 method to attract a specific item or person. With the 3-6-9 method, you write down what you want on a slip of paper. Usually, you’ll just write one word to represent what you want, such as “car” or your crush’s name. Write 3 scripts in the morning, 6 scripts in the afternoon, and 9 scripts in the evening. [14] X Research source If you want to take it one step forward, sleep with your scripts under your pillow.

steps.title: Imagine what success would feel like.
steps.content: Imagine what success would feel like. Emotions increase your vibrations and help you add more energy to your manifestation scripts. As you increase your energy, you can improve your ability to manifest what you desire. As you write your scripts, really focus on how getting what you want will make you feel. [15] X Research source You might feel warm and fuzzy when you think about going out with your crush, or you could feel excited and adventurous when you climb behind the wheel of your new car.

steps.title: Believe your script is true.
steps.content: Believe your script is true. When you’re manifesting, you have to believe that you deserve what you want and that you’ll get it. Do your best to stay positive and believe that you can achieve what you want. [16] X Research source Try re-reading your script and using it as motivation to keep working toward what you want. It’s helpful to make your script believable. For instance, you might use script manifesting to attract a promotion at your job, which is believable. On the other hand it’d be less believable that you could become the leader of a country using script manifesting. Remember that actions are super important. Script manifesting isn’t like wishing for something—it’s a tool to help you pursue what you want.

steps.title: Keep your scripts totally positive.
steps.content: Keep your scripts totally positive. Any kind of negative language will interfere with your manifestation. Similarly, using limiting words like “maybe,” “hopefully,” or “I guess” will undermine your efforts. Always write your scripts from a place of positivity, gratitude, and abundance. [17] X Research source Instead of “I guess I want a new car,” write “I love my new car!” Rather than “Hopefully Drake will ask me out,” write “Drake asked me out, and I said ‘yes.’”

steps.title: Take action toward your goal or dream.
steps.content: Take action toward your goal or dream. Script manifesting isn't like a genie in a bottle—what you write down won't just appear. You have to work toward what you want. [18] X Research source Identify the first few steps you need to take to get what you want. Then, start working on the first step. If you want a promotion, you might talk to your boss or put in your application for an open position. If you’re hoping your crush will chat with you, you might post a cute snap with a message about being single or you could go to an event you know they’re attending. If you want a new car, you might start shopping around or start saving money for a down payment.

steps.title: Attract your crush.
steps.content: Attract your crush. “My crush and I are on a romantic date on the beach. We spread my white beach blanket down on the sand. We brought a full picnic basket with sweet watermelon and grapes, a variety of cheeses, and summer sausage. For dessert, we have cupcakes. The salty sea air is filling my nose, and I’m so excited to finally be here.”

steps.title: Get your dream job.
steps.content: Get your dream job. “I started my new job today, and I’m so happy! I get to spend my day writing, and all my coworkers are friendly. I’m playing jazz music on a Bluetooth speaker to create a nice ambiance and sipping on tea while I write.”

steps.title: Obtain something you want, like a car.
steps.content: Obtain something you want, like a car. “I just bought a shiny yellow Volkswagen Beetle with comfortable grey seats. The new car smell greets me when I open the door. The Bluetooth lets me play all my favorite songs as I cruise around the neighborhood. I hung a rearview mirror ornament that looks like a flower so I remember to be grateful for my new car.”

steps.title: Attract money.
steps.content: Attract money. “I have all the money I need to pay for what I want. My bank account is thriving, and I always have enough. I can buy anything I want and am generous with my friends. My life is full of abundance.”

steps.title: Get your dream house.
steps.content: Get your dream house. “My new house is a two-story bungalow with a wide front porch, complete with a swing. It has large windows so the rooms are full of sunlight. The floors are hardwood, and the walls are all painted lovely colors. I’ve filled the house with eclectic furniture that makes me feel cozy.”
